title: Late to Work
description: Ray Bolger finds himself considerably hard put to get to the theater in time for his performance.

title: Firing Molly
description: Ray Bolger as Raymond, Alyn Joslyn as his brother, Jonathon. The family insists Ray fire his wardrobe lady.

title: Find Tremont
description: Ray Bolger as Raymond, Alyn Joslyn as his brother, Jonathon. Musical comedy star Jan Clayton will appear with Ray in a singing and dancing role.

title: Lt. Oglemeyer
description: Raymond gets a chance to even the score with his wartime Lieutenant for past treatment when the LT. sends a note backstage that he is in the audience.

title: Pola Ashenfelder
description: Raymond discovers the disastrous results of indiscriminate casting.

title: Gondorff
description: Through a friend, and against his brother's wishes, Raymond is talked into investing in a vague oil deal with an eccentric Texan.

title: Process Server
description: Ray lands in jail when he destroys a summons handed to him by a process server.

title: Thanksgiving: Masterson
description: Ray patches up a feud with a former high school rival whose daily newspaper column criticizes Ray's show.

title: Prize Fighter Morenco
description: Ray buys up a contract on a fighter who has never won a fight and hopes by psycho-analysis to make him a champion.

title: Insurance Loophole
description: Ray gets disgusted with his brother Jonathon's meticulous business practices and hires an actor to disprove his brother's theories.

title: Understudy
description: Ray consents to let his understudy do a number in the show because the understudy's girlfriend is in the audience.

title: Christmas
description: Through a little girl's imagination Ray becomes a cab driver, a pixie-like floorwalker in a toy shop, an old vaudevillian, his own imaginary wife, Sambo the doll, and Santa Claus.

title: New Year Party
description: Ray's plan to spend New year's Eve alone, fixing up his new apartment is radically changed when his girlfriend springs a surprise housewarming on him.

title: Pilot
description: Ray buys a pair of dancing shoes for a young senorita just because he likes to do nice things for people.

title: Susan, the Horse
description: Ginny confesses to Ray that she is planning to run away from home because her mother and father are going to get a divorce.

title: The Maid
description: Ray lands in hot water when he goes out of his way to be nice to a lovesick laundress who has a crush on him.

title: The Teenager
description: A high school co-ed who worships Ray's terpsichorean prowess is disgusted with her football hero boyfriend's clumsy efforts on the dance floor.

title: Find the Dog
description: Ray's efforts to find a little boy's lost dog sends Jonathan on a search for Ray's "little lost mind".

title: Redecorate the Coffeshop
description: Ray takes over the management of June's restaurant for a day but makes the grave mistake of brushing off a health-inspector.

title: Who's Getting Married?
description: Ray and his girl have a lovers quarrel. After a week's separation their first meeting is at the license bureau, where each suspects the other's motives for being there.

title: Will You Be My Cook?
description: Ray's kindness to an old lady, who he thinks is an unemployed cook pays off when she turns out to be a millionheiress.

title: The Honeymoon's Over
description: Ray dons his "Charlie's Aunt" costume and plays the good samaritan to his stand-in who is having trouble.

title: Ray Plays the Stork
description: Ray plans a surprise to spring on his in-laws when he assumes the party they are giving will announce a forthcoming blessed event.

title: Let's Get Ray Married
description: When Ray is selected as one of the country's ten most eligible bachelors, his family decides he has been single too long.

title: The Shoe Store
description: Brother Jonathan thinks Ray should have some outside business investments. Ray makes them...and gets the business.

title: Cuddles
description: "Cuddles" is just a Cocker Spaniel to Ray but to Jonathan it means a chorus girl. Confusion and embarrassment reign when this creature is discussed.

title: The Enlisted Reserves
description: The spirit of patriotism moves Ray to join the Enlisted Reserve Corps. (Hollywood)

title: The Return of Millie
description: Memories of a delightful high school association are revived for Ray when he receives a telegram from a girl who was his dancing partner in those days, informing him that she is coming to town.

title: Juvenile Delinquency
description: A trio of juvenile delinquents who think all dancers are sissies learn a new respect for the art when Ray takes them under his wing.

title: A Double Life
description: Ray's sidekick, Pete Morrisey is jealous of Ray's success with the ladies and claims it is due only to the dancer's fame. The two make a bet and swap identities. Ray moves into Pete's apartment and two girls move in next door. (original breakdown)

title: The Masquerade Is Over
description: Ray decides to reveal his true identity to Susan, but the complications which arise make the unmasking very painful to our hero.

title: Getting Susan a Job
description: Ray's girlfriend , Susan, needs a job in order to remain in New York. Ray uses His influence.

title: The Drama School
description: Ray enrolls in a phony dramatic school in order to save Katie and Artie from being duped by the school operator.

title: Stag at Bay
description: Susan's girlfriend Katie, learns that the sea of matrimony is mighty deep when her boyfriend arrives in New York to pop the question.

title: Miss Teenager
description: Joan Gentry, who wins the "Miss Teenager" contest is awarded a trip to New York as her prize. She also wins Ray as an escort for her big-city nights and immediately "falls in love" with him.

title: The Novelist
description: Clarke Reynolds, a handsome novelist, becomes interested in Ray's girlfriend, Susan. In order to divert Reynolds' attention from his girl, Ray encourages a stage struck blonde to act as a decoy.

title: Publicity Pete
description: Ray finds he is the proud possessor of a self-appointed publicity man: his pal. Pete, starts his job by releasing a story about Ray's search for a wife who is an expert cook.

title: Angel in Disguise
description: Ray tries to help an aspiring artist land a commission to paint socially prominent Mrs. Schuyler.

title: Katy Gets Glamourized
description: Ray helps Katy Jones and Pete Morrisey in their scheme to impress a snooty young woman who has recently arrived in town.

title: Ray Helps Young Married Couple
description: Pete Morrisey rents Ray's apartment to a young out- of- town married couple. Ray mistakes these tenants for the potential backers of a show he plans to produce.

title: Jealousy
description: Ray sees his girlfriend, Susan, being escorted home by an office boy, but mistakes the strange male for Mr. Universe.

title: The Navy Show
description: Ray's girlfriend suffers because the dancer is preparing a show for the Navy. Ray is kept so busy with his extra duty that he is forced to break a number of dates he had with Susan.

title: Father for a Day
description: Ray Wallace celebrates Christmas by acting as a father for a day. In the holiday spirit, Ray brings home two young orphans to spend Christmans with him.

title: Man of the Year
description: Pete Morrisey latches on to a press agent's dream when he plans to have Ray make "Man of the Year". The only fly in the ointment is Ray himself, who isn't too sure he wants the dignified title.

title: Seeing Double
description: Pete Morrisey has another one of his "great ideas'. This time he is busy promoting a contest to find his client's double.

title: Girl on a Billboard
description: Ray Wallace helps out a young bronco buster who is in love with a lovely model.

title: A Gift from the Sultan
description: Ray Wallace does a command performance for a sultan and is given an unusual and unexpected reward for his efforts.

title: Night School
description: Ray Wallace charms a shy schoolteacher into giving his pal, Artie Herman, a passing grade in a night school course. The schoolmarm becomes enchanted with Ray.

title: Ray's Ex-Partner
description: Ray's ex-partner, Bill Johnson, doesn't have enough money to keep his nightclub in operation. Ray comes to the rescue with an offer of financial aid.

title: Predatory Female
description: Ray's nimble feet come in handy when a rich woman uses her wiles to make him her eighth husband.

title: Professor Spiff
description: An old professor of Ray's comes to visit the dancer in New York. He brings his fiancée, a gold digging chorus girl.

title: Ideal Husband
description: Ray becomes involved in a "My Ideal Husband" contest with the help of his girlfriend's' friend.

title: Ray Humanizes Pete
description: Ray outfits himself as a penniless tramp to show cynical Pete Morrisey that most people feel compassion for their fellow man.

title: Reunion of Squad B
description: Ray has a reunion with his old army buddies. In the course of the reminiscences Ray impersonates a blonde WAC and a "Sad Sack" G.I.

title: Herman, the Wonder Dog
description: Ray helps an old vaudevillian and his "Wonder Dog" to get employment at the theater he is playing.

title: The Efficiency Expert
description: Nght-watchman Otto Kleinschmidt's job is endangered when an efficiency expert feels he has outlived his usefulness. Ray tries to help his pal.

title: Ray's Mother and Father
description: We go back to 1915 to witness the wooing of Virginia Randolf by Ray's father. Virginia's father is opposed to show people in general and to Ray Sr. in particular.

title: Last of the Showboats
description: Ray brings two orphans home and does his famous scarecrow dance for them.
